CodeList.Name: Date Imputation Flag

Description.TranslatedText: Date Imputation Flag: Indicates the level of imputation reflected in a date value.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Day Imputed: Day is imputed.
Month Imputed: Month and day are imputed.
Year Imputed: Entire date (year, month and day) is imputed.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Date Imputation Flag Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Derivation Type: Analysis value derivation method.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's average value over a defined set of records.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best possible outcome.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing baseline observation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Baseline Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best outcome recorded within a subject.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous best-case non-missing value.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Best Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A technique that uses assignment logic to duplicate an analysis value to be used in additional evaluations.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to an estimation of a value based on extending a known sequence of values.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to one half of the lower limit of quantification of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to a function of known values to estimate a value within the range.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of detection of a test.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of quantification of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous non-missing value.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Last Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last recorded non-missing observation.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last observed value prior to the start of study treatment.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Last Value Prior to Dosing Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's maximum value over a defined set of records.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's minimum value over a defined set of records.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the estimate that maximizes the probability of observing what has in fact been observed.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value from a comparator or reference group.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Mean of Other Group Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Mean Observed Value in a Group
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value observed in a group of subjects.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Mean Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A technique that creates a record with a missing analysis value when there is no observed record for a given analysis visit or analysis timepoint.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's next-to-last non-missing value.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing screening observation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Screening Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of detection of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Upper Limit of Detection Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of quantification of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Upper Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst possible outcome.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst recorded outcome within a subject.
A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's worst-case non-missing observation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Worst Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Worst Observed Value in a Group
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst value observed in a group of subjects.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Worst Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

CodeList.Name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Code

Description.TranslatedText: A parameter code codelist for the Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 Questionnaire (GAD-7 V2) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 - Total score used for analysis.

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Code
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Code Terminology

CodeList.Name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Name

Description.TranslatedText: A parameter name codelist for the Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 Questionnaire (GAD-7 V2) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 - Total score used for analysis.

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Name
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Name Terminology

CodeList.Name: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Code

Description.TranslatedText: A parameter code codelist for the Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form questionnaire (GDS02) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total score used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total Score

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Code
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Code Terminology

CodeList.Name: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Name

Description.TranslatedText: A parameter name codelist for the Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form questionnaire (GDS02) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total score used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total Score

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Name
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Name Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Parameter Type: Indicates whether the parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Derived: Indicates that a parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.

CodeList.Name: Pool for Integration

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the name of the Pool, often defined in the integrated statistical analysis plan, which identifies the combination of subjects' clinical trial experience and will be the focus of the integrated analysis.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The pool that includes data across all studies within which the subject has participated, used for the overall integrated analysis.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Pool for Integration Terminology

CodeList.Name: Subject Trial Status

Description.TranslatedText: Indicates the status of the subject in the trial.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion. (NCI)
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption. (NCI)

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Subject Trial Status Terminology

CodeList.Name: Time Imputation Flag

Description.TranslatedText: Time Imputation Flag: Indicates the level of imputation reflected in a time value.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Hours Imputed: Entire time (hours, minutes and seconds) is imputed.
Minutes Imputed: Minutes and seconds are imputed.
Seconds Imputed: Seconds are imputed.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Time Imputation Flag Terminology
